item.title: Entity Framework - Entity Framework Core - DbContext configuration and initialization - Context pooling
item.description: "EF Core can pool your context instances: when you dispose your context, EF Core resets its state and stores it in an internal pool; when a new instance is next requested, that pooled instance is returned instead of setting up a new one."

item.description: "This article shows basic patterns for initialization and configuration of a DbContext instance."

item.description: "OnModelCreating implements the OnModelCreating mapping attribute."

item.description: "This paper describes the use of navigations in the Entity Framework (EF)."

item.title: Entity Framework - Entity Framework Core - Create a model - Relationships - Foreign and principal keys
item.description: "One-to-one and one-to-many relationships are composed of two one-to-many relationships, each of which is itself defined by a foreign key referencing a principal key."

item.title: Entity Framework - Entity Framework Core - Create a model - Relationships - Many-to-many
item.description: "Many-to-many relationships are used when any number entities of one entity type is associated with any number of entities of the same or another entity type."

item.title: Entity Framework - Entity Framework Core - Create a model - Relationships - One-to-one
item.description: "One-to-one relationships are used when one entity is associated with at most one other entity. For example, a Blog has one BlogHeader, and that BlogHeader belongs to a single Blog."

item.title: Entity Framework - Entity Framework Core - Create a model - Relationships - One-to-many
item.description: "One-to-many relationships are used when a single entity is associated with any number of other entities."
